issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Mapreduce jobs fail when StoragePolicy is set

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When setReplication, the FSDirectory#updateCount need calculate the related storageTypes quota,but will check the file consume the ds quota is positive.
     Actually,it's may set replication after create file,like  JobSplitWriter#createSplitFiles.
    It's also can reproduce on command shell:
    1.  hdfs storagepolicies -setStoragePolicy -path /tmp -policy HOT
    2.  hdfs dfs -touchz /tmp/test
    3.  hdfs dfs -setrep 5 /tmp/test
fields.summary: set replication for empty file  failed when set storage policy

[~Deng FEI], 
Thanks for the good find and patch.

Fix looks good. 

1. It would be better to add a simple MiniDfsCluster test. mostly in {{TestSetrepIncreasing.java}}

Nits:
bq. The patch file was not named according to hadoop's naming conventions. Please see https://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/HowToContribute for instructions
You can name the patch in this format,*HDFS-9625.003.patch*

+1 once addressed.

[~vinayrpet]
Thanks for your good advice.
I have uploaded the new patch,please check it once.
